title: 1956 Chevrolet 3100

description: This first series 1955 Chevrolet 3100 is the final year of the iconic Advanced Design, making it one of the rarest around.  But you really are just going to love it because the terrific old-school presentation inside & out feels like a time machine.

This truck is truly rolling history at its finest.  1955 was the final year for the Advance Design trucks that got America moving again after WWII.  This pickup really symbolizes the attitude that jump started us back into peacetime.  With the wood rails on the wood truck bed makes it looks like it could still go to work today.  But take a closer look.  The extra gloss of the lumber matches nicely with the extra luster of the more modern application of the yellow and tan paint.  And if it's shine you like, the bumpers and two-piece wheels really add to this bright presentation.  Plus, the way the panels fit on this pickup, let you know someone took the time in restoration to erase its workman past without erasing its historic appearance.  It's the perfect balance of period-correct and premium.

The interior is still working-class all the way, but that's all part of the vintage truck appeal. The vinyl bench seat shows virtually no wear, and the same can be said for the door panels and rubber flooring.  Pickups from the 1950s didn't come adorned with a long feature list, and that actually adds to this 3100's charm.  This is part of an era where its heater was a valued option because it gave you a chance to warm up on your way home from working the day in the outdoors.  Those are the kinds of things you think about from this truck's big airy and open cabin.  You get to connect to a bygone era every time you grab the three-spoke steering wheel, rest your hand on the tall gearstick, and gaze at the large original gauge package.

Under the hood is a 261 cubic-inch inline six. It's an upgrade in displacement over what was available in the 3100 for '55 without losing the iconic Job Master/Stovebolt attitude.  In fact, we know you'll love showing off all the details, from the long blue motor, to the silver oil bath air cleaner, to all the correct markings.  While this is not an all-out speed machine, the four-speed manual transmission ensures you are in complete control of the powerband.  Besides, you don't buy a truck like this for all-out performance.  Sure, a small block fits easily in the engine bay, but your largest enjoyment is watching others see you ride around town in this alluring package.  And right now you get to do that with an intoxicating rhythmic chug that comes from true vintage truck motoring.

The Advance Design trucks were only in production for less than half of '55 before their successor started coming down the line.  So a rare First Series pickup from 1955 always is a great distinction to have.  And so when you look at the rarity, terrific presentation, and affordable price, you realize you need to hurry to grab this deal. Call now!
title: 1955 Chevrolet 3100

description: Just Toys Classic Cars is proud to present this very cool 1954 Chevrolet 3100 pick up truck.  This truck turns heads anywhere it goes and is a great driver.  The restoration is about 7 years old and still presents very well.  The body of this truck is in great shape and you would be very proud to own it.    As you can see the interior has been redone.  The bench seat is recovered in black vinyl and everything presents well in here as well.  There is an AM radio as well.  These trucks were very basic back in the day and that was a simpler time in life.    Under the hood is the original 235 Blue Flame straight 6 cylinder with an Offenhauser intake manifold and dual carbs.  This really has some nice low end punch.  That is mated to a 4 speed manual transmission and all goes out through a 10 bolt rear end.  This is a super fun truck to drive and turns heads where ever it goes. description: This 1955 Chevrolet 3100 1/2 Ton Stepside Shortbed 2 Door Pickup
Stock # F13247
is available in our Fairfield, CA showroom and any inquiries may be directed to us at 707-419-8200 or by email at [Sales@SpecialtySales.com](
mailto:Sales@SpecialtySales.com
Sensational 1955 Chevrolet 3100 Stepside Shortbed Pickup

New to our Fairfield showroom is this gorgeous 1955 Chevrolet 3100 1/2 Ton Stepside Shortbed 2 Door Pickup with black exterior paint and a matching black cloth interior.  You’ll find a Chevy 350 cid V-8 engine under the hood with an Edelbrock  manifold and carburetor, a four-speed manual transmission with Hurst floor linkage.  It also has a beautiful Oak bed in the back with old school Centerline wheels to complete the look.  This prestigious pickup has been very tastefully restored throughout and it would make an excellent weekend cruiser or a great start for someone who wants to fully customize their own resto-mod pickup.
Beautiful Older Restoration w/ Sensational Curb Appeal

In terms of condition, this 1955 Chevrolet 3100 1/2 Ton Stepside Pickup really impresses as an older restoration that has received immaculate care in recent years.  As you can see from the photographs, the body lines are exceptional and the paint still shines bright up close.  The hardwood bed and metal dividers also stand out with very little noticeable wear, while the engine compartment resembles a fresh install with lots of chrome and polish.  Most would consider this a high level driver with tons of upside due to extensive upgrades and a nice balance between classic charm and real world performance.

Additionally, this 1955 Chevrolet 3100 Pickup drives like a champion with very nice acceleration throughout the gears, nice handling and a smooth overall ride.  It needs nothing to be enjoyed right away and this prestigious classic is available at a steal of an asking price.
Available at a Steal of a Price for this Level of Quality

Overall, this 1955 Chevrolet 3100 Shortbed Pickup is in very nice condition and it is ready to be enjoyed right away as a high end driver.  It would also make an excellent project vehicle to take to an entirely new level as well though, so it should appeal to a wide variety of collectors.  Either way, this one is priced to sell or offers an excellent value for one lucky collector.  For more information about this impressive vehicle, visit our Fairfield, California showroom, give us a call at 707-419-8200, or email us at [Sales@SpecialtySales.com](
mailto:Sales@SpecialtySales.com
).  Be sure to mention
Stock # F13247
as well.

description: 1955 NAPCO CHEVROLET 4X4            The trend today on trucks and off road vehicles is to lift them up high for more clearance and better off road performance ...That trend really started in the late 70's lifting trucks and such and actually very few of them were really used off road  but it did look cool and so the trend continues ....           Well back in the day.... I love saying that .....Well back in the day, and I do mean back in the day....1955 to be exact . NAPCO specialized in building vehicles and conversion systems that provided serious off road capabilities for Ford, Chevrolet, and Studebaker and had been in production since 1942.... By 1955 NAPCO Power-Paks could be purchased through a Chevrolet dealership for use on a new truck but the conversion had to be installed at the dealership.... As a test for 1956 GMC offered a 4x4 NAPCO conversion installed at the plant and covered by the GM warranty by 1957 the option was coded as RPO 690....and was available from the plant on either GMC or Chevrolet.           NAPCO conversions have proven to be super durable and effective off road machines and the trend was set  .....NAPCO  maintains a very high profile these trucks appear to have been lifted however the ride and clearance heights were designed into them from the very beginning ...  NO LIFT KIT REQUIRED          These trucks are at the very pinnacle for collectability and value . They rate right there with the Cameo's .......           235 cubic inch 6 cylinder Factory four speed with Granny 1st  Rubber mounted transfer case with dual range option............

description: Gateway Classic Cars of Orlando Florida  is proud to offer a very cool 1953 Chevrolet 3100 pickup. Built with a classic look, this '53 has all the equipment you'd want in a classic truck. The truck rides and drives great and will be the envy of anyone who sees it .  It has that classic look that will draw attention wherever you go. Under the hood is a 216 CID 6 Cylinder engine.  It has an 3 speed manual transmission.. The exterior finish is candy apple red and white two tone . Inside the truck has a beige and candy apple red bench seat and custom matching door panels. The dash houses classic gauges .This truck is the one to have ! The way this one is set up, it makes a very reliable, comfortable daily driver type truck. With plenty of storage in the back, it would be a great truck to take on a road trip. A few cool touches include the Chrome  wheels. There is no doubt, wherever you pull up in this truck, people will turn their heads. You can see this 1953 Chevrolet 3100 pickup in greater detail in our Orlando Florida showroom or at www.GatewayClassicCars.com. description: 1957 Chevrolet 3100 Shortbed Custom Truck.This truck was a nut and bolt restoration that took several years to do. We will describe the truck inside and out.Â A beautiful deep dark purple color with lots of pearl. The paint is so deep that you can see your reflection in it. The truck is painted inside and out. The inside of the cab, doors, jambs, dash and interior are all the same dark purple. The inside of the bed is painted to match. The exhaust on the truck looks great it is custom as well. The exhaust comes out just above the rear bumper and towards the back. The bed is custom as well. The chrome strips accent and highlight the depth in the wood. The wood in the bed is an exotic wood known as Purple Heart. The wood is custom cut and finished to put into the truck.The interior of the truck as been finished in grey and black highlights. The seat is new along with the rest of the interior. The dash looks great as well as the custom gauges. The glass is all new. The door glass has been converted to a one piece glass with a nice kit from the Truck Shop. The truck does not have a heater or ac. crate motor 400 along with an automatic 400 transmission. The motor and transmission run and sound great. The motor puts down enough power to light the tires up and it still runs very cool. The aluminum four core radiator ensure that the truck runs nice and cool. The front end is off a Chevy Camaro and the rear-end is a Chevy rear end with 3.73 posi-traction rear-end. The lug bolt pattern is all the same around the truck (5 x 4 3/4). The battery is relocated to the bottom of the bed. Also the disc brake booster has been relocated. The engine bay is clean and the wires are hidden.Â The truck is currently registered, clean title in my name. -Vehicle is on consignment and at our clients home -Please Call First and talk to a rep at 231-468-2809 EXT 1 -Showroom is by appointment only Please Call -If you would like a FREE Listing please visit our consignment page or Call
